Over 870 civilians killed in Koje area
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed that killings of civilians were committed three times in Koje area of South Kyongsang Province from April 1949 to July 1950 in connection with the case of the "converts federation" which was faked up under the pretext of helping those with the leftist idea make ideological conversion, "protecting" and "guiding" them and the number of the dead totaled 878, according to the Yonhap News from Seoul.
 Jon Kap Saeng, researcher of the society for the study of the modern history of South Kyongsang Province, at the inaugural meeting of the "Koje society for the bereaved families of the civilians killed before and after the Korean War" on August 21 made this assertion in his paper published under the title "truth of Koje area."    
 At the meeting the Koje society of bereaved families and the South Kyongsang regional meeting for the settlement of the issue of civilian killings in the open questionnaire addressed to the Koje city authorities and "assembly" demanded them build an office to prepare notices on the civilian dead and form a special fact-finding committee of mass killings.
